meanings.definition: Advertorials: advertisements in the form of editorial content
meanings.sent1: Magazines often include advertorials to promote products in a subtle way.
meanings.sent2: The advertorials in the newspaper seamlessly blend with the regular articles.
meanings.sent3: The advertorials in the magazine were so convincing, I almost thought they were real news!
meanings.sent4: Her speech was like an advertorial, smoothly selling her ideas to the audience.
meanings.sent5: The advertorials on the website were so engaging, I couldn't tell they were ads.

meanings.definition: Advertorials: promotional articles designed to resemble editorial content
meanings.sent1: The advertorials in the brochure looked like regular articles but were actually ads.
meanings.sent2: Companies use advertorials to promote their products in a more subtle way.
meanings.sent3: The advertorials in the magazine were so cleverly disguised, readers were surprised to learn they were ads.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was an advertorial, hiding her true feelings behind a promotional facade.
meanings.sent5: The advertorials on the website were like hidden gems, blending seamlessly with the other content.
